intro: Jussiaea repens, commonly known as the creeping jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often covered in fine hairs. Jussiaea repens thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetland or marshy environments.
